info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 12 at 3:00AM CST until January 12 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Rapid Spread of Wildfire Possible Through This Afternoon... .A strong cold front this morning will bring a surge of very dry air and strong northwesterly winds through the afternoon. Winds are expected to diminish this evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE COMBINATION OF LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS, AND DRYING FUELS, FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS EXCEPT THE BARRIER ISLAND... * AFFECTED AREA...All of Deep South Texas Except the Barrier Island. * TIMING...6 AM this morning through 4 PM this afternoon. * WINDS...Northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 67. * LIGHTNING...None. * IMPACTS...Rapid spread of wildfire on drying grasses and brush is possible Friday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
